message: Decide the default visibility for the list custom fields. This affects how the fields are presented to subscribers
Maximum number of active campaigns a customer can have, set to -1 for unlimited
Whether customers can send recurring campaigns
Maximum number of subaccounts the customers can create, set to -1 for unlimited
Are you sure? The tour contains valuable information to help you get started. You will not see the tour again if you end it!

Please note, when adding a bounce server make sure the email address is used only for automated sending and/or reading bounce email but nothing more.
This is important since the script that checks the bounced emails needs to read all the emails from the account you specify and beside it can be time and memory consuming, it will also delete all the emails from the email account.
Important note: some SMTP servers will not allow you to use a different bounce address than the one you use to authenticate. In this case, make sure you use same account for sending and for bouncing.

Please note that the server settings will be checked when you save the server and the save process will be denied if there are any connection errors.
Also, this is a good chance to see how long it takes from the moment you hit the save button till the moment the changes are saved because this is the same amount of time it will take the script to connect to the server and retrieve the bounced emails.
Some of the servers, like gmail for example, are very slow if you use a hostname(i.e: imap.gmail.com). If that's the case, then simply instead of the hostname, use the IP address.
You can use a service like hcidata.info to find out the IP address of any hostname.
A new abuse report has been created for the campaign "{campaign_name}". Please visit the "Abuse Reports" area to handle it!

In order to start sending emails using this server, we need to make sure that it works, therefore we need to send you an email with a confirmation link. Once you confirm this server, this message will go away and the server will become active and ready to be used.
Please note, for sending the confirmation email, we will use the information you provided when you created this server.
If you think you need to adjust the options, please feel free to do it now and save your changes before going through the validation process.
Please specify at least the email and/or the reason!
By subscriber uid or email address

Please note, when adding an email box monitor make sure the email address is used only for it, nothing more.
This is important since the script that checks the emails needs to read all the emails from the account you specify and beside it can be time and memory consuming, it will also delete all the emails from the email account.

Please note that you have to add the following cron job in order for this feature to work:
{cron}

These conditions will be applied to the email body and if matched, the given action will be taken against the email address.
Conditions are applied in the order they are added and execution stops at first match. The asterix wildcard (*) matches everything.

Please note that the server settings will be checked when you save the server and the save process will be denied if there are any connection errors.
Also, this is a good chance to see how long it takes from the moment you hit the save button till the moment the changes are saved because this is the same amount of time it will take the script to connect to the server and retrieve the feedback emails.
Some of the servers, like gmail for example, are very slow if you use a hostname(i.e: imap.gmail.com). If that's the case, then simply instead of the hostname, use the IP address.
You can use a service like hcidata.info to find out the IP address of any hostname.

The template you create with the builder must be modified only using the builder.
Do not modify the template outside the builder, it will break.

Please note, when adding a feedback loop server make sure the email address is used only for reading feedback email but nothing more.
This is important since the script that checks the bounced emails needs to read all the emails from the account you specify and beside it can be time and memory consuming, it will also delete all the emails from the email account.

Please note, these pages are the base pages shown in customers area for each list.
The customer has the ability to modify them to fit their needs for any particular list.
Transactional email sender, runs once at 2 minutes.
Bounce handler, runs once at 10 minutes.
Feedback loop handler, runs once at 20 minutes.
Delivery/Bounce processor, runs once at 3 minutes.
Daily cleaner, runs once a day.
For best delivery rates, your domain DMARC record must look like:
Whether to unsubscribe, delete or blacklist the subscriber.

- a fatal error means a SMTP error that has a return code higher or equal to 450.
- this happens when for example the account we try to send the email does not exist on the target server, or it has been closed.
- please note there are cases when the smtp server will directly return a fatal error if your server is blacklisted there so you might want to set a higher number here to avoid this.

- a soft error means a SMTP error that has a return code lower than 450 but higher than 2xx(which is a success code).
- this might happen if the subscriber account is temporarly disabled, or the receiving server is too busy, etc. Usually you'll want this option set to a high number.

- after the email has been delivered, there are chances the target server will bounce it back for several reasons.
- a hard bounce means the email does not exist anymore on the target server, or it has been blacklisted, disabled, etc.
- you should keep this option set to a lower number.

Unlike hard bounces, soft bounces can happen for reasons like server/account temporarily unavailable, not enough disk space to store the email on the server, or even the response of an autoresponder.
- you should keep this option set to a high number.

Whether to enable hourly checks against sending domains and their DNS records. If the checks fail for certain sending domains, notifications will be emitted and the sending domains will require to be manually verified once again. Use with extra care.

Whether to enable hourly checks against tracking domains and their DNS records. If the checks fail for certain tracking domains, notifications will be emitted and the tracking domains will require to be manually verified once again. Use with extra care.
List of IPs allowed to access the api. Separate multiple IPs by a comma
You can use {url} to generate the DMARC records.
Please DO NOT SKIP verification unless you are 100% sure you know what you are doing.

Please note, when adding a bounce server make sure the email address is used only for automated sending and/or reading bounce email but nothing more.
This is important since the script that checks the bounced emails needs to read all the emails from the account you specify and will delete them all after processing.
Important note: some SMTP servers will not allow you to use a different bounce address than the one you use to authenticate. In this case, make sure you use same account for sending and for bouncing.

* if multiple recipients, separate the email addresses by a comma.
* the email tags will be parsed and we will pick a random subscriber to impersonate.
* the tracking will not be enabled.
* for the test email only, the subject will be prefixed with *** TEST ***
* make sure you save the template changes before you send the test.

Hidden fields are rendered in the form but hidden, while None fields are simply not rendered in the form at all.

Please note, you will have to style the forms below to match the place where you embed them.
You can create better forms by using the PHP-SDK and connect to the provided api.

Please note, we only accept valid CSV files that contain a header, that is the column names for the data to be imported.
We also have a limit on the file size you are allowed to upload, that is {uploadLimit}.
The import process might fail with some of the files, mainly because these are not correctly formatted or they contain invalid data.
You should first do a test import(in a test list) and see if that goes as planned then do it for your actual list.
Important: The CSV file column names will be used to create the list TAGS, if a tag does not exist, it will be created.
You can also click here to see a csv file example.

Please do not forget to add the webhook url into your Stripe dashboard, this is maybe the most important thing you have to do, without it, customers will not be assigned to customer groups.
The webhook url that you have to add is: {url}
Please note that {here} you have a screenshot showing how the webhook has to be added and what event type you must select.
Subscriptions are created on a monthly basis, so please make sure your customer groups sending quota targets the monthly time unit, this is very important.

You have to set the absolute path to the storage folder where you will upload attachments. By default it is: {path}
After you set the storage folder, inside it, you can upload your subscriber specific attachments but make sure you create subfolders and you upload the attachments in these subfolders.
For example, you can have following structure:

Then in the campaign setup step, you will be able to select the "{folder}" folder as the folder from where the attachments will be loaded. Also, you will be able to select which custom field represents the file name.

Please note, once you select a template, the existing content of the campaign template will be overridden by the one you have selected.
If you don't want this, then just click on the cancel button and you will be redirect back to the inital template page.
Since this is an Autoresponder campaign, the recipients count will be adjusted while the campaign is running.
For Autoresponders it is perfectly normal for the number of recipients to be 0.
By default, Autoresponders target only subscribers added to your email list after the Autoresponder itself has been created.
If you need to target more subscribers from the start, include imported and/or current subscribers.
